result.execSummary:
The defendant Arthur L Grover was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court will waive any costs and surcharges that can be waived. Pay all other mandatory costs and surcharges during term of probation or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Arthur L Grover not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant was not produced from MSDF.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Arthur L Grover not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Pre-trial conference held.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Bikesmiths at 2865 N Murray Ave, Milwaukee, WI  536211

Defendant Arthur L Grover in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Arthur L Grover in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Arthur L Grover not in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 2/6/15 @ 1 PM
